description: Cross the treacherous river by hopping on floating logs and diving turtles in this timing-based classic.
rationale: This game focuses on the river-crossing mechanic of Frogger, providing a high-stakes environment for AI agents to learn predictive movement and timing. It targets developers interested in grid-based pathfinding and collision detection in dynamic environments.
details: The game consists of a 10x10 grid. The bottom row is the starting safe zone, and the top row is the goal zone. Rows 2 through 9 are river lanes. Each lane has platforms (Logs or Turtles) moving horizontally at different speeds and directions. Logs are stable platforms. Turtles are platforms that periodically submerge; if the player is on a turtle when it submerses, they fall into the river. If the player touches the water (any grid cell in the river not occupied by a platform), the game ends. The player must navigate from bottom to top.

game_rules.physics: The player moves with the platform they are currently standing on.
game_rules.win_condition: Reach any cell in the top row.
game_rules.lose_condition: Touch water or move off-screen boundaries.

how_to_build: uv venv && uv pip install pygame
how_to_play: Use UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT arrow keys to move the frog one grid square at a time. Score +10 for moving forward to a new row, +100 for reaching the goal. Avoid the blue water areas. Stay on logs or turtles, but jump off turtles before they turn dark blue (submerged).
